a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Literacy rate of young men vs. women, 2021
Share of women and men aged between 15 and 24 years old who can both read and write.
Data source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics via World Bank (2023)
Note: UNESCO defines literacy as reading and writing brief daily life statements. However, criteria vary by country, and North American and
Western European data uses more detailed assessment so isn't globally comparable.
